fire…[/gva_box_color][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row isfullwidth=”0″ css=”.vc_custom_1617428807710{margin-top: -55px !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: repeat !important;}”][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6″][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][gva_block_heading title=”A Passion For Souls” style=”style-2″ align=”align-left”][/gva_block_heading][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]It all began with a passion for souls, which has been unquenchable since its birth. Having a passion for souls, would make soul winning be the main business of our lives, which is one of the things Christians are living for as the scripture categorically stated that “he that winneth souls is wise”. The Restoration Apostle, Prof. Johnson Suleman, being that always dedicated and devoted person in all his doings, could not further contain the barely controllable emotion to populate the kingdom of God; of course with souls.
Furthermore, same way no one reads Romans chapter 9 without understanding Paul’s burning passion for lost souls, so it is with The Restoration Apostle when you get to know anything about him. He has considered whatever is lost for the sake of winning souls as nothing. That is why he apparently preaches salvation virtually in all his meetings not minding the theme and in same vein, admonishing the world populace to do same.
The Apostle’s love for God cannot be defined enough using any word even. He craves after the lost world, possessing an inner undying quest for revival. Whatever makes God happy is his hobby.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6″][vc_single_image image=”4170″ img_size=”full” alignment=”center”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row row_space=”remove_padding_top” css=”.vc_custom_1617105522528{padding-top: 80px !important;padding-bottom: 50px !important;background-color: #f4f5f9 !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6″][vc_row_inner css=”.vc_custom_1617421180994{margin-bottom: -50px !important;background-color: #0166bf !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column_inner offset=”vc_col-xs-6″][gva_block_heading title=”Connect With Us” style=”style-2″ align=”align-left” style_text=”text-light” desc=”Aenean lacinia bibendum nulla sed consectetur. Integer posuere erat a ante venenatis dapibus posuere velit aliquet.” subtitle=”We are not far from you!”]We have churches in 2 nations in five continents, so you can worship with us in any of the continents. You can reach the regional headquarters directly to confirm which branch is closer to you in any of the continents OR check directly on the International Branch Network Database here.[/gva_block_heading][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner css=”.vc_custom_1617421252824{margin-top: -80px !important;background-color: #0166bf !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]– International/Africa – Nigeria: +2347061382277, +2348064646180. Email: info@ofminternational.org
– North America – (United States): +13479382402[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]– Europe – (London): +447950770396
– Asia – (Malaysia): +60104664285
– Australia – (Australia): +61470494664[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6″][gva_box_video photo=”4148″]#[/gva_box_video][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=”.vc_custom_1617110137733{background-color: #112a6d !important;}”][vc_column]
